docs.lead_paragraph: Even the Democrats who supported President Barack Obama's health care legislation last March aren't exactly making the bill the center-piece of their re-election campaigns. Everyone, that is, except Rep. Scott Murphy of New York.

headline.main: Murphy Embraces Health Care in Ad

docs.abstract: Scott Murphy, the Democratic incumbent from the 20th District in New York, says his challenger is a friend of the insurance companies.
docs.snippet: Scott Murphy, the Democratic incumbent from the 20th District in New York, says his challenger is a friend of the insurance companies.

headline.main: TPG and K.K.R. Make Approach to Seagate

docs.abstract: The approach, which if completed would be the largest leveraged buyout this year, comes just weeks after TPG and another firm, Silver Lake, ended talks with Seagate.

docs.lead_paragraph: National Democratic officials have decided that their attacks on undisclosed  corporate money are working, and they have decided to intensify the argument in the final days of the midterm campaign.

headline.main: Democrats Press Attack on Secret Money

docs.abstract: Letter to editorial writers explicitly links the fund-raising practices of conservative groups to big corporations and Wall Street firms.
docs.snippet: Letter to editorial writers explicitly links the fund-raising practices of conservative groups to big corporations and Wall Street firms.

docs.lead_paragraph: Is the cost of health insurance so out of reach that even when the federal government helps out, many people still can't afford coverage? According to a new analysis by the Employee Benefits Research Institute, the answer may be yes.

headline.main: Fewer People Choose Cobra Subsidy Option

docs.abstract: A new analysis by the Employee Benefits Research Institute questioned whether even subsidized coverage is too expensive for many Americans.
docs.snippet: A new analysis by the Employee Benefits Research Institute questioned whether even subsidized coverage is too expensive for many Americans.
